1.text: Use your favorite bread dough recipe as your base recipe.

2.text: Substitute high protein flour for regular flour to get the right texture.

3.text: Use slow rise yeast or double the yeast to ensure the dough will rise.

4.text: Leave the dough to rise for 45 minutes.

5.text: Punch down and shape the bread dough into your desired shape.

6.text: Transfer the dough onto a greased baking sheet or into a loaf pan.

7.text: Transfer the bread dough into the freezer uncovered for 1 to 2 hours.

8.text: Package the frozen dough into plastic freezer wrap or bags.

9.text: Write the date on the plastic so you know when to use the dough.

10.text: Put the dough back in the freezer for up to 6 months.

11.text: Thaw the dough for at least 4 hours at room temperature.

12.text: Bake the bread dough according to the recipe instructions.
